zone.line: Ode to Naples
Naples! thou Heart of men, which ever pantest
Naked beneath the lidless eye of Heaven!
Elysian City, which to calm enchantest
The mutinous air & sea! they round thee, even
As Sleep round Love, are driven;
Metropolis of a ruined Paradise
Long lost, late won, & yet but half regained!
the
Bright Altar of a bloodless sacrifize
Which armed Victory offers up unstained
To Freedom, flower-enchained.
Thou which wert once, & then didst cease to be,
Now al art, & henceforth ever shalt be free;
If Hope & Truth & Justice can avail,
Hail, Hail, all - hail! -
Thou youngest Giant birth
Clothes Which from the groaning Earth,
Leap'st, clothed in armour of impenetrable scale;
Last of the Intercessors
